info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 4:31PM CDT until October 24 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coke, Irion, Runnels, Sterling and Tom Green.
* WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern San Angelo, Robert Lee, Blackwell, Maverick, Bronte, Miles, Carlsbad, Grape Creek, Water Valley, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, San Angelo State Park, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Broome, Orient, Tennyson, Arden, Fort Chadbourne, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, Us-87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line and The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Howard and Webster, Ranch Road 853 crossing east Rocky Creek, FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch, Ranch Road 853 crossing Middle Concho River, FM 1692 crossing The Draw, RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, Ranch Road 859 crossing west Rocky Creek, Juniper Road crossing just east of Highway 277, Saynor crossing Mule Creek and Graham Valley crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Coke, TX; Irion, TX; Runnels, TX; Sterling, TX; Tom Green, TX
